void overmap::add_mon_group ( const mongroup &  group)

Definition at line 4759 of file overmap.cpp.

4760{
4761 // Monster groups: the old system had large groups (radius > 1),
4762 // the new system transforms them into groups of radius 1, this also
4763 // makes the diffuse setting obsolete (as it only controls how the radius
4764 // is interpreted) - it's only used when adding monster groups with function.
4765 if( group.radius == 1 ) {
4766 zg.insert( std::pair<tripoint_om_sm, mongroup>( group.pos, group ) );
4767 return;
4768 }
4769 // diffuse groups use a circular area, non-diffuse groups use a rectangular area
4770 const int rad = std::max<int>( 0, group.radius );
4771 const double total_area = group.diffuse ? std::pow( rad + 1, 2 ) : ( rad * rad * M_PI + 1 );
4772 const double pop = std::max<int>( 0, group.population );
4773 for( int x = -rad; x <= rad; x++ ) {
4774 for( int y = -rad; y <= rad; y++ ) {
4775 const int dist = group.diffuse ? square_dist( point( x, y ), point_zero ) : trig_dist( point( x,
4776 y ), point_zero );
4777 if( dist > rad ) {
4778 continue;
4779 }
4780 // Population on a single submap, *not* a integer
4781 double pop_here;
4782 if( rad == 0 ) {
4783 pop_here = pop;
4784 } else if( group.diffuse ) {
4785 pop_here = pop / total_area;
4786 } else {
4787 // non-diffuse groups are more dense towards the center.
4788 // This computation is delicate, be careful and see
4789 // https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/issues/26941
4790 pop_here = ( static_cast<double>( rad - dist ) / rad ) * pop / total_area;
4791 }
4792 if( pop_here > pop || pop_here < 0 ) {
4793 dbg( DL::Error ) << "overmap::add_mon_group: " << group.type.str()
4794 << " - invalid population here: " << pop_here;
4795 }
4796 int p = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( std::floor( pop_here ) ) );
4797 if( pop_here - p != 0 ) {
4798 // in case the population is something like 0.2, randomly add a
4799 // single population unit, this *should* on average give the correct
4800 // total population.
4801 const int mod = static_cast<int>( 10000.0 * ( pop_here - p ) );
4802 if( x_in_y( mod, 10000 ) ) {
4803 p++;
4804 }
4805 }
4806 if( p == 0 ) {
4807 continue;
4808 }
4809 // Exact copy to keep all important values, only change what's needed
4810 // for a single-submap group.
4811 mongroup tmp( group );
4812 tmp.radius = 1;
4813 tmp.pos += point( x, y );
4814 tmp.population = p;
4815 // This *can* create groups outside of the area of this overmap.
4816 // As this function is called during generating the overmap, the
4817 // neighboring overmaps might not have been generated and one can't access
4818 // them through the overmapbuffer as this would trigger generating them.
4819 // This would in turn to lead to a call to this function again.
4820 // To avoid this, the overmapbuffer checks the monster groups when loading
4821 // an overmap and moves groups with out-of-bounds position to another overmap.
4822 add_mon_group( tmp );
4823 }
4824 }

private

Iterate over the overmap and place the quota of specials.

If the stated minimums are not reached, it will spawn a new nearby overmap and continue placing specials there.

Parameters
enabled_specialsspecifies what specials to place, and tracks how many have been placed.
